name: Cook the Book: Preserved Lemons and Preserved Lemon Vinaigrette
description: The photo spread that accompanies the how-to on preserving lemons in "Canal House Cooking, Volume 1." While perusing the pages of Canal House Cooking, I found myself at a bit of a loss. You see, every week I look though...
recipeIngredient: Sterilized wide-mouthed container with a tight-fitting lid
Rind of half of a preserved lemon
Juice of half of a fresh lemon
1/3 cup really good extra-virgin olive oil

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the lemons (almost all the way through) into quarters, keeping them attached at the stem end. Working over a bowl, tamp the inside of each lemon with salt. Tightly pack the salt-filled lemons into the sterilized container. Pour more salt over the lemons and squeeze the juice from several fresh unsalted lemons into the container as you fill it up.
